image.altText: Bree James post cropped

props.synopsis: Barron River LNP candidate Bree James posted a photo of the defaced poster, with a caption in which she said that "even my banner is getting in the spirit and celebrating my German heritage".

title.children: LNP leader says Cairns candidate's German joke beside Hitler moustache graffiti was 'wrong'

image.altText: A ruler hitting a hand.

props.synopsis: Katter's Australian Party candidates vow to "bring back the smack" as they campaign on youth crime ahead of the Queensland state election.

title.children: Katter party candidates campaign to bring back corporal punishment for children

image.altText: a young man in a white t-shirt

props.synopsis: Scientists have developed tiny biological bridges, each made up of millions of nasal cells, which they hope will encourage nerve cells to regenerate and grow over a patient's spinal cord injury.

title.children: Human trial to treat patients paralysed by spinal injury with cells transplanted from their nose

image.altText: Early voting Queensland

props.synopsis: With so many Queenslanders now opting to vote early, it doesn't make sense for the political parties to wait until the home stretch of the election campaign to unveil their major initiatives.

title.children: Go hard, go early: Big pre-poll voting numbers changing how parties campaign

image.altText: An older man wearing a suit and tie with grey hair pushes up his glasses, standing next to a younger man in suit talking

props.synopsis: Voters say housing, cost of living and crime are key issues ahead of next weekend's Queensland election. With polls predicting a leadership shake-up, what impact could the result have on the federal election?

title.children: Voters seem poised to take 'grievances' out in Queensland. What does this mean for the federal election?

image.altText: A man and two women are standing in a dusty paddock, under a sunny sky. Their hands are out patting the white herd of goats

props.synopsis: When the Jessen family lost their major milk processor, they were able to pivot but they want to see more industry representation across the country.

title.children: Dairy goat farmers confident in future despite lack of industry representation

image.altText: Large man in Akubra, white and blue shirt,  writes on an ipad, leans on cattle rail. Five men stand on a steel platform.

props.synopsis: With a front-row seat to the Australian cattle market for more than 30 years, Trevor Hess loves reporting on its highs and lows.

title.children: As a boy, Trevor skipped school to watch auctioneers sell cattle. Then he made it his career

image.altText: Brisbane Broncos NRL player Ezra Mam.

props.synopsis: Brisbane Broncos star Ezra Mam allegedly fails a roadside drug test after a traffic collision on Friday night, with the club working with the NRL's integrity unit.

title.children: Broncos star Ezra Mam allegedly unlicensed as NRL integrity unit investigates car crash

props.synopsis: Steven Miles and David Crisafulli are making the most of their chance to get their message out before Queenslanders head to the polls next Saturday.

title.children: It's getting to the pointy end of the Queensland election campaign and the media opportunities are getting more outlandish

image.altText: A woman in a black and red blouse with long black hair and red lipstick.

props.synopsis: Chito started a petition to make racism grounds for expulsion after her daughter was repeatedly vilified by a boy in her class.

title.children: Queensland mother calls for students to be expelled for racism after daughter 'forced' to be in class with boy who 'dehumanised' her

image.altText: a legalise cannabis volunteer holding out a flyer

props.synopsis: Labor is recommending its voters put Legalise Cannabis Queensland second in all but one of the seats the minor party is running candidates.

title.children: 'Gloves are now off': Labor preferences Legalise Cannabis Queensland ahead of Greens in 28 seats

image.altText: A pool in the foreground surrounded by large rocks and plants, with a sauna shed, and a larger building up a grassy hill.

props.synopsis: Deep in the NSW hinterland, medical students are living alongside patients who are trying to overcome addiction. It's hoped the live-in, six-week program will give the future doctors a greater understanding of substance abuse.

title.children: The retreat where medical students live with drug and alcohol addicts to improve future health care

image.altText: A man stands in a suit speaking.

props.synopsis: Liquidators have a "mandatory examination" power under the Corporations Act to call in officers of a company, such as directors, to question them under oath about what went wrong.

title.children: David Crisafulli not called to court over failed training organisation he headed despite other top brass being summonsed to testify

image.altText: Ringer holding bottle of water

props.synopsis: Lake Nash Station, one of the oldest cattle runs in the country, was cut off for months by floods in 2023 —but it's bounced back and is now preparing to be flooded by schoolies.

title.children: Why school leavers from the city are saddling up and moving to 'the end of the world'

image.altText: A ship pulls Taipan wreckage from the ocean, authorities are in a smaller watercraft nearby

props.synopsis: An inquiry into a helicopter crash off the north Queensland coast hears the ADF ignored safety concerns from test pilots about high-tech helmets before four aviators died in 2023.

title.children: 'I failed them': Retired test pilot apologises to families of ADF members killed in Taipan helicopter crash

image.altText: craig moore in a branded election cap in front of his election sign

props.synopsis: Craig William Moore was jailed for 14 months after he was convicted of rape in 1997.

title.children: LNP 'unaware' an independent it preferenced in Brisbane electorate was a convicted rapist and former porn star

props.synopsis: Health Minister Shannon Fentiman and her opposite Ros Bates clash over hospital targets, abortion laws and controversial how-to-vote cards in the penultimate week of the Queensland election campaign.

title.children: Drugs, abortion and hospital beds heat up the health debate

image.altText: Front of Redland Hospital on Brisbane's bayside in August 2017

props.synopsis: Queensland Health director-general Michael Walsh says an investigation into cancer screening services at the Redland Hospital has revealed the "health system let these people down".

title.children: Investigation into cancer screening bungles reveals 73 patients received 'suboptimal care' at Queensland hospital

image.altText: Boy in red tshirt stands on the road in front of flooded street, a car is submerged under water

props.synopsis: A federal flood insurance inquiry has found evidence of systemic problems during the 2022 floods, including inconsistent decision making, poor-quality expert reports and long delays.

title.children: Calls to ban flood-prone housing as federal flood insurance inquiry finds companies 'failed too many people'

image.altText: A close up of a hand holding a electoral brochure

props.synopsis: As the state heads to the polls for the 2024 Queensland election, around 30 per cent of booths won't be fully accessible.

title.children: One third of Queensland voting booths are not fully accessible, forcing many to request postal ballots

image.altText: A fisherman smiling and wearing a hat.

props.synopsis: A Labor election policy aimed at growing recreational fishing tourism will spell the end to the historic Fraser Coast fishing industry, commercial fishers say.

title.children: Fishers say Labor policy will finish historic Fraser Coast fishing industry

image.altText: A close up of a green sea turtles face with red dots on the scales.

props.synopsis: The artificial intelligence used for passport facial scanning is now helping Australian conservationists track elusive sea turtles.

title.children: Uncovering the mysteries of the deep with a little help from AI

image.altText: Man standing in checked blue and white shirt with white cowboy hat

props.synopsis: LNP candidate Sean Dillon says he was assaulted on a remote road in outback Queensland.

title.children: Police investigate alleged assault of Queensland LNP candidate

image.altText: A sign reading Wippo Creek stands on bare ground amid sparce, low scrub with four-wheel drive vehicles in the background.

props.synopsis: A missing Kimberley man was likely met with "foul play" while on a pig hunting trip with six other men, a Queensland coroner has ruled.

title.children: Missing man likely met 'foul play' on illegal hunting trip in outback Queensland, coroner finds

image.altText: A woman in a bike helmet with brown hair rides her bike in the country.

props.synopsis: Lisa Millar returns to her home town of Kilkivan to learn about its new rail trail and is reminded the decline of these small country towns doesn't have to be a permanent trend.

title.children: How a rail trail revived Lisa Millar's hometown

image.altText: Floral tributes that were left at the scene.

props.synopsis: David George Connolly, 43, died after being wounded in the chest by the then 17-year-old boy on Newmarket Road in Wilston in 2023.

title.children: Teenager who stabbed a man with a 40-centimetre knife in Brisbane's inner north found guilty of manslaughter

image.altText: A blue and yellow card with the faces of David Crisafulli and Ros Bates along with a list of candidates.

props.synopsis: The issue of abortion has dogged the LNP during the campaign, with LNP leader David Crisafulli refusing to rule out a conscience vote where MPs are not forced to toe the party line should they win government.

title.children: LNP health spokeswoman preferences party that is anti-abortion second on how-to-vote card

image.altText: Two police officers in a tin boat in the river

props.synopsis: The 18-year-old drowned in Townsville's Ross River while fleeing police in 2022. A coronial inquest has heard it is unlikely that his death could have been prevented.

title.children: Inquest hears no evidence of police misconduct in drowning death of young Indigenous man

image.altText: Woman outside a wooden hall.

props.synopsis: With environmental issues front of mind for some voters, and others firm believers in a resources-led future, Far North Queensland's four state seats are all up for grabs in the October 26 poll.

title.children: Far North Queensland political 'melting pot' emerges as key battleground in state election

image.altText: A koala going through a swing door

props.synopsis: A unique collaboration in south-east Queensland will introduce one-way escape hatches so the marsupials can travel to their breeding spots without doubling back into traffic.

title.children: Queensland to trial 'koala doggy doors' to reduce roadkill rates

image.altText: Bowie the blind Australian Shepherd

props.synopsis: Maximilliano Cardozo was charged with ransacking a family's home, stealing their car and driving their pet dog interstate during an alleged burglary, but walked free from court after being found unfit to stand trial.

title.children: Charges dropped against man accused of stealing blind dog during alleged home break-in

image.altText: Two men in suits waving to the crowd.

props.synopsis: In a Queensland election debate devoid of big moments, both leaders tried to wedge each other on familiar ground.

title.children: Miles and Crisafulli used their debate to drive home messages but didn't deviate far from the script

image.altText: A young woman with dark brown hair smiles for a portrait.

props.synopsis: Easing the cost of living and making it more attainable for young people to buy a house will be the deciding factors for some young voters on October 26.

title.children: 'My future's been taken away': Concerns for young voters ahead of Queensland election
